title: Electric PE - W and U when distances are halved

content.question: Four positively charged particles, each with the same charge <math alttext="positive q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math>, are initially located at the corners of a square of side length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math>, as shown in the figure. In this configuration, the electric potential energy of the four-particle system is <math alttext="U sub L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>L</mi></msub></math>. External forces then move the particles closer together to a final configuration where the particles form a square of side length <math alttext="L over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>. If <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math> is the total work done by the external forces in moving the particles from the initial to the final configuration, how does <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math> compare to <math alttext="U sub L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>L</mi></msub></math>? What evidence or reasoning supports the claim?

choices.label: <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math> is equal to <math alttext="U sub L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>L</mi></msub></math>. The total charge of the system does not change.

<math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math> is equal to <math alttext="U sub L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>L</mi></msub></math>. The electric potential energy of the system is doubled.

<math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math> is greater than <math alttext="U sub L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>L</mi></msub></math>. <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math> is equal to the change in potential energy of the system.

<math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math> is greater than <math alttext="U sub L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>L</mi></msub></math>. The particles repel, so positive work is done by the external forces.

content.answer: <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math> is equal to <math alttext="U sub L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>L</mi></msub></math>. The electric potential energy of the system is doubled.
